result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Skill, Fees, and Equilibrium AUM ** A manager can generate **α = 2.4%** per year up to **$364m** of capital; above that, incremental α ≈ 0. The fund charges **0.7%** on total AUM. Assume investors flock in until **net α = 0**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Equilibrium AUM
Dollar alpha at capacity: α × capacity = 2.4% × $364m = $8.74m per year.
At equilibrium, investors add capital until **dollar α = fees**:
fee × AUM = 0.7% × AUM = $8.74m ⇒ AUM = $1248m (rounded).
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Fee revenue at equilibrium
Fee revenue = fee × AUM = 0.7% × $1248m = $8.74m per year.
Notice this equals the manager’s **dollar α at capacity**: $8.74m. Intuition: competition drives **net α to investors ≈ 0**; skilled managers capture the rents via fees.
::: :::
